website_summaries.verdict: A great CPU that should deliver all of the power and speed you need for a variety of computing tasks.
pros: Trusted brand name with a type of processor technology that has proven successful over time
Will give you 3.7GHz of processing speed as well as turbo enhancements up to 4.7GHz
Six-core processor that excels for multi-tasking, gaming, or VR experiences
cons: Price point is a little high
Will need to purchase a fan and heat sink separately

website_summaries.verdict: A good middle of the road computer processor that balances a lower cost with better speed.
pros: Computer processor comes with compatible motherboard and cooler in certain purchase options
CPU uses a standard motherboard socket for wide compatibility
cons: CPU comes clocked slower than advertised

customer_reviews.title: awesome Processor can't really go wrong with an i5
customer_reviews.text: came in time for the build! awesome Processor can't really go wrong with an i5.... if your looking to render Massive video files or major editing i wouldn't upgrade to a i7
customer_reviews.author: Edgar J. Romero

customer_reviews.title: Best CPU you can buy for under $200
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th build with this CPU (3 of them for computers running Blue Iris Security camera software). Great performance and Blue Iris is much much happier with this i5. My 7400 series was often hitting 80% cpu usage with 6 cameras in 720p resolution; with this bad boy it is now averaging 9 percent cpu usage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superb CPU!
customer_reviews.text: For anyone on a budget, looking to get the best bang for your buck... let me eliminate your guess work... GET THIS CHIPSET. It is an extremely powerful CPU for the price and don't let the clock speed worry you, this Chip will run close to 3.9 on multiple cores. Pair this up with a z370 motherboard to make the best of it. If you are on a budget, you won't regret getting this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast, great for gaming well worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from an old AMD 955 black edition to the 8400. Work greats, much faster, improved gaming results, all the obvious things. Only downside is I'll need a space heater for my office, my old amd 955 worked great in that regard.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Mid-Level Gamers!
customer_reviews.text: Great! Runs super fast in games paired with a GIGABYTE GTX 1080. Can get hot but with the right cooler, should be okay. Heavily recommended for a mid-level gaming build!
customer_reviews.author: Lainie

customer_reviews.title: Mind Blowing performance
customer_reviews.text: Its so fast... Its so ungodly fast. I've never seen a CPU this fast in my life. This chip is incredible. What do you wanna do on a pc? Anything? Everything? I cant think of anything I could wanna do that I cant do on this CPU. By the way, this card is a perfect match for a GTX 1660. If thats the card your looking at, this is the cheapest CPU to enjoy that card at its full potential.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: DON"T NEED AN i7 FOR GAMING WITH THIS CPU!!
customer_reviews.text: 6 cores and 6 theads,, More than you need for any game. Grab a B360M motherboard and set all cores to 4.0ghz and xmp boost your ram,,, boom, you have a gaming monster that is with in 6-10% of an i7 8700 in all gaming applications.!! Pair with any GPU and have no worries. Best gaming cpu in my opinion for the dollar period. And I have owned and benched all the coffee lake series cpu's.. This one by far is my guilt free cpu when spending for gaming. You will have zero regrets buying this cpu guaranteed.!!
customer_reviews.author: AlphaBlades

customer_reviews.title: nice cpu
customer_reviews.text: it is easily installed. i used my old cooler master 212 evo on had a my 1155 socket cpu on it. i haven't pushed this cpu like i did my previous but it works well. the core temperature are in the high 3x and low 4x when boot from a cool state. but i haven't stressed it to see how high it will go. only game i played so far was rad rodgers and it handle that easily with a gtx 1060. will update review if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Richie

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU for everyday use, but even gaming.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a build that is used for thermal imaging. The 8400 is a powerful processor for its class. Can't overclock it since it's not unlocked, but it still handles rendering thermal images like a champ, and given the option, can even hold up with AAA title games.
customer_reviews.author: Borsalino A.

customer_reviews.title: It does support LGA1551 sockets
customer_reviews.text: I have no problems with the CPU I’ve had for almost a month now it’s definitely budget friendly, it helped me on my motherboard that supports a LGA1151 socket I’m glad it could come with a stock cooler fan too. If you’re new to PC building this is ideally a good CPU for your setup it’s very underrated and I don’t see in the near future trying to replace this chip. You can’t overclock it it’s locked but really it’s worth the price and the performance it comes along with it.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel P

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Working well so far. Mine came with a CPU cooler fan (that I didn't end up using), that does already have thermal paste applied on it so you don't have to do it yourself.
customer_reviews.author: SBG

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Clearly marked as a 2.8 GHZ processor. However, in the description of the item it stated it as a 4.0 GHZ. They have since changed the headline to say "up to 4.0 GHZ". After about 1 week of gaming, I would have to say I see a noticeable upgrade from my previous CPU (i5-7400 3 GHZ). Also, I use this PC for video editing and this new PC made a HUGE difference. Happy with my purchase. Only gave 4 stars due to the misleading title when first purchased.
customer_reviews.author: carlos avila

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, but Hyper Threading not available?
customer_reviews.text: I am satisfied overall with i5s over i7s, as I did my wife's previous build with a 6th gen i5. The specs sheet says Hyperthreading is supported, as well as my new motherboard (MSI B360M Mortar), however the BIOS says it's not available? I may come back and amend my rating if I figure it later. otherwise, it's as powerful as ever with an 8th gen.
customer_reviews.author: Ean P.

customer_reviews.title: Best Value For CPU in 2018
customer_reviews.text: Quality CPU. Probably the best value for a solid budget gaming build in 2018. If you are intending on playing any new large open world games in higher resolutions I would recommend the 8700k, but for medi-high settings at around 40-50 fps on such games in 1080p, this CPU works excellently. Also pretty decent for HD video editing/rendering.
customer_reviews.author: Nicodemus

customer_reviews.title: easy to install, and it's lightning fast. runs pretty cool without much modding
customer_reviews.text: I have a thermalite fan and artic thermal paste, and this runs about 44-48 degrees centigrade for me, so that' pretty cool form what I'm used to. It is lightning fast and I've so far been very impressed with this CPU for the cost. I got away from AMD after getting tired of various problems I've had over the years with them.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Cormier

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and runs smooth
customer_reviews.text: Paired with an EVGA 1070 and currently running most of my competitive games (R6S, OW, etc.) on higher settings at 90-100+ fps for a consistent, smooth and quiet experience. I limit my games to about 120 fps usually, use that GSync to run beautifully but to not overwork my computer. Very happy. Maybe consider a better CPU fan but that about it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Before you buy
customer_reviews.text: More than I needed. If you are on a budget, I would recommend a newer (8th gen and above) i3 and put the money you save towards a more powerful graphics card. However, all in all I love my i5 and it'll stay with me for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: 6 cores on a budget!
customer_reviews.text: This is the cheapest 6 core processor you can get, and it is very nice. I decided this was the ideal processor for my HTPC gaming build, since I didn’t plan on overclocking and didn’t want to drop a bunch of money on an i7. This processor is more than sufficient for my build and gets an enthusiastic 5 stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: great processor
customer_reviews.text: this is a great processor it runs all my games smoothly on max i run it with a gtx 1060 6 gig and 16 gigs of ram i have owned it now for a little over a year and have had no problems with it i would definitely buy it again
customer_reviews.author: harold

customer_reviews.title: Great i5, Killing my I7-4790
customer_reviews.text: Really nice build with this processor, stock cooling is quiet and fine, and the unit is making my I7-4790 feel sad, as it is a definite upgrade from that model. For the price, this processor makes for a really nice fast desktop, and paired with 32GB of ram, I can't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Allred

customer_reviews.title: Great performance per dollar
customer_reviews.text: I originally wanted the i5 8600k, but I couldn't justify the price difference. If you need a great processor for gaming or any other CPU intensive software loads, and you're not interested in over clocking, this is probably the best Intel solution for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell B.

customer_reviews.title: Powerfull and cheap
customer_reviews.text: The best generational jump is 7th to 8th, this i5 work perfectly for gaming (high ipc) and it have a good amount of cores and speed. Buy this instead of the 8600k, if you want a better cpu jump to 8700 or 8700k.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Gomez

customer_reviews.title: one of the best processor out there!!!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best processor out there. I got this processor for a very good price which I have never seen again because its' always out of the stock or very expensive. I guess I got lucky. I highly recommend it!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Yunio

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for most things.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic price compared to the other options, you lose overclocking and just a touch of speed, but if you aren't a super heavy online gamer, and do light-moderate drafting or tasks that aren't overkill demanding at home, perfect. I do a bit of gaming, 3D work, and editing at home and I have no issues with this cpu.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan

customer_reviews.title: I build only INTEL CPU based workstations for my clients
customer_reviews.text: I build only INTEL CPU based workstations for my clients. INTEL CPU's rarely fail even when my clients have not kept them properly cooled. I prefer INTEL over AMD nine out of 10 times. Over the years I have had multiple AMD CPU's fail while the INTEL may tend to run at a lower speed.
customer_reviews.author: ABCServices

customer_reviews.title: Zoom goes the new cpu
customer_reviews.text: Makes my old AMD cpu look like a pocket calculator. 6 cores 6 threads of buttery smoothness for a reasonable price. The intel chip that punches well above it's weight class. Didn't receive case badge - 0/5 stars
customer_reviews.author: PhildoBaggins

customer_reviews.title: Quick, Good Price
customer_reviews.text: Handles multi and single thread applications great, I think the price point was very good at the time of purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Problem solved - works great.
customer_reviews.text: I had problems with a gaming desktop system, so I decided to rebuild it with a new motherboard and CPU. The install was easy and the upgraded system has been running for eight months without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly the CPU for me
customer_reviews.text: I am a programmer, non-gamer, multi monitor loving guy and this CPU does it all very easily for LOW power (65W) all day/night long. With a Cooloermaster cooler (for tropical usage where I am), 32 G Corsair RAM and Samsung SSD - Asus MB - cannot be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Aveesh Kumar

customer_reviews.title: I'm an Intel fan
customer_reviews.text: I've always used Intel products. Part of my company is IT training and we order PC builds for our students. I've never had problems with Intel CPU's. The one thing you may want to be aware of is compatibility, make sure the board supports the edition you're purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Defective, maybe good cpu if it worked
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, but I think the one i received was defective. Made clicking noise like it the cooling fan was hitting something constantly. Would short out in 3 different motherboard setups I tried. Will be sending back and buying a different generation.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: not sure if its working
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to get this computer operational.. I have lots of money tied up in it.. Not for sure what part is defective..
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: WOW - i5 with 6 cores
customer_reviews.text: love it, its so fast and can handle multitasking like nothing I have experienced. Being a designer (video, photo), mobile game developer, gamer and streamer the multitasking is very important. I usually spring for an i7, but these 6 cores had me curious. This i5 is far superior than any previous gen i7. Save yourself the money and look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Marz

customer_reviews.title: This is one case where you don't get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Way overpriced for the quality. Computer isn't necessarily slow, but it certainly isn't lightning fast, and there are a quite a few lag issues. 8G ram, so I know that's not the issue, especially when I'm talking about simply browsing and watching YouTube.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: It kept crashing my computer
customer_reviews.text: I wish i could have seen this in full action put my computer kept crashing so i had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Balancekeeper

customer_reviews.title: this is a great choice for the price ive had 0 temp issues ...
customer_reviews.text: For people wandering should you get this or the 8700k or even the 8600, this is a great choice for the price ive had 0 temp issues and no throttling or slow downs at all and it handles everything i put it through.
customer_reviews.author: robbie moore

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: First install BIOS has temp checks and output was pleasantly surprised. 60c at idle. Great processor for budget price. P.S. dont buy a fan if yo buy this it comes with a heatsing/fan with thermal paste already on it
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Intel always delivers
customer_reviews.text: Works well for gaming and is a beast for office products.
customer_reviews.author: frank watts

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Works great and easy to install. THose who are looking into buying one for a budget gaming rig should buy this. Just make sure you get a motherboard that is compatible with this chip , also one you can update to a higher processor because you will probably want one as time goes on because games of course will need more power in later years. But this one will play everything you've always wanted to without any problems. Games i have installed are: Elder Scrolls Online , Fortnite, COD, League of Legends and so on. You can play a range of games with this chip.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU for gaming
customer_reviews.text: I love my i5, it works so much better than the i3 I had, the i3 could handle games but when it comes to video editing and streaming, it was lagging. My new i5 works great and can handle it all. If you cannot afford the i7 then this will be more than enough to run any game.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Rigsby

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money. working perfectly after 2 month's of use.
customer_reviews.text: Great cpu, incredible temperatures, if u are going cheap just go with amd, but this aint a bad deal.
customer_reviews.author: Maxter

customer_reviews.title: Good product, great for gaming
customer_reviews.text: This was great for when I build my PC. Works great for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Sprklindiamond

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a gaming rig that I built and wasn't the most impressed with it. I also have an older i7-4790K with a base clock speed of 4.0 GHz (turbos up to 4.4 GHz) and it feels just so much faster than this. For the price, I'd say just save a buck and get an older i7, this one didn't impress me all that much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Speedy little thing... love it,, totally out classes my lower end i7
customer_reviews.text: Nice, fast and efficient, excellent Processor... totally out classes my i7 cant beat the number of hard and fast cores in this processor.. works great!
customer_reviews.author: CMA Major Rocketman

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal for Intel CPU over the Years
customer_reviews.text: The 8-th gen intel CPU has the best upgrade over the past years. With a 3rd party cooler, the CPU is able to work at the turbo frequency (~3.9GHz) stably over time. And the performance is really stunning. I usually used some scientific computing server for my project where I usually got assigned 10 cores, but this CPU is only slightly slower even though it only has 6 cores.
customer_reviews.author: He Xiaoxuan

customer_reviews.title: Enough for me.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have the cash to buy a higher version but this is enough for me right now and I can play most video games with this paired with a 1070ti without any issues and zero bottlenecks.
customer_reviews.author: Misha

customer_reviews.title: Great chip by Intel
customer_reviews.text: Super great processor, had for over a year now with 0 issues
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Budget
customer_reviews.text: This makes an amazing processor for budget builds and mild overclocking. Performs with games like doom eternal and for a horizon 4 with no issues. Great for gaming but that’s about it I still recommend a ryzen cpu however as one at this price will perform way better.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Levreau

customer_reviews.title: Best budget CPU
customer_reviews.text: This is the best budget gaming CPU you can find in market right now. With the ryse of Zen, I wanted to buy Ryzen but I think I made the correct choice. As great as Ryzen is, it was its first generation. If 2nd had been released at that time, maybe I would have gone for that but I still say this, intel Core i5 8400 is today what 2500k was back in its time. The best gaming budget CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Jalaleen

customer_reviews.title: Faulty CPU
customer_reviews.text: I hope someone can help. I bought this to be paired with this Motherboard Its the Gigabyte Geforce GTX that it was suggested to be used. CPU fault light is on. I'm also past my product support date. HELP !
customer_reviews.author: Ramon Khan

customer_reviews.title: failed.
customer_reviews.text: It failed today. First time in my life this happens with CPU. Completely dead.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Blazingly fast and an incredible upgrade for any previous-gen i3 ...
customer_reviews.text: Blazingly fast and an incredible upgrade for any previous-gen i3 or i5 user (as well as plenty of older gen i7 users!).
customer_reviews.author: Chris Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Good processor
customer_reviews.text: It has been working and does good work great upgrade from a 2500k
customer_reviews.author: Jason Sisson

customer_reviews.title: Fast and durable
customer_reviews.text: Good speed and great for over clocking. Gaming is smooth and glitch free. Stays cool and performs well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffry L Priddy

customer_reviews.title: Good. Worth it, just don’t upgrade from an i3 if you have one because that would not be worth it, at least it wasn’t to me.
customer_reviews.text: I would have liked to seen the Gugahertz be a little higher, similar to the i3, but overall, is worth the money and performs well...I had another use for my i3 so this went good with my new build.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M.

customer_reviews.title: Buyer be aware - read the fine print
customer_reviews.text: I've received a weirdly open box item. A bit pricy for the condition an age of the CPU. Given the fact that is functional - so far, I did not returned.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Saidac

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got it when it was $180
customer_reviews.text: Its the coolest CPU in the house compared to my i7 920@3.8Ghz space heater ya I know 10 years to upgrade.. Pushes my Evga 1070 absolutely fine so I might be ready for at least 3-5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. JZ

customer_reviews.title: Best value processor on the market.
customer_reviews.text: The Intel core i5-8400 is the best value processor on the market period. Great for gaming and productivity work. Pair with an SSD for a blazing fast experience.
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Processor
customer_reviews.text: This process was very easy to install, and didn't require a liquid cooling system. This process is not use for gaming; however music and videos are viewed using this processor. The multi-tasking done on this process suits the needs of the person using this processor.
customer_reviews.author: HenryHug54

customer_reviews.title: Great processor if you don't do a lot of multi-threaded ...
customer_reviews.text: Great processor if you don't do a lot of multi-threaded work. I would've probably been better off with a 4c/8t, but this one performs for what I need it to do -- at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Joe K

customer_reviews.title: CPU for a mid-tier build
customer_reviews.text: This i5 8400 is a nice choice for a mid-tier gaming pc build at this point. 2.8 ghz base clock might seem low but it turbos to almost 4ghz. Better value for money than the i5 8500.
customer_reviews.author: BuildHobbyist

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Put this on my home built used for flight simulation. Works excellent and when I monitor CPU usage this baby is hardly utilized at all. Best part of my entire system.
customer_reviews.author: JAM

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works great it just sucks that I replaced this i7 first gen with an it but this i5 is great
customer_reviews.author: kevin thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great processor
customer_reviews.text: I mostly use my computer to make music, and this processor handles whatever I need
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great Processor
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic processor and works really well. I was working on building an inexpensive computer and this was a very good choice in processor.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: A+++
customer_reviews.text: Intel is just too good and stable. They have made another mid range chip that is just fantastic and reliable. Fast as the average user needs.
customer_reviews.author: spencer ammons

customer_reviews.title: Must have for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Glad I went with this, for the money you can’t beat it. This was my first PC build and using “user benchmark” my PC is rated UFO. A+
customer_reviews.author: Da_Vinci_B

customer_reviews.title: the product description does not mention that this CPU comes ...
customer_reviews.text: the product description does not mention that this CPU comes with the stock Intel CPU fan. so far, CPU is working as expected
customer_reviews.author: JHL

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Another Intel processor that works well. They're like appliances now. Love the six core design. Install it and forget about it since there's no overclocking. It runs cool and so far has taken everything I've thrown it.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: good cpu
customer_reviews.text: I really like it, i'm in saudi arabia and still not that much heat !!! in gaming of 8 hours + daily with itself fan!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: working great no issues playing 7 days to die and have ...
customer_reviews.text: working great no issues playing 7 days to die and have played PUBG some Battlefield 4 and 1 watch a lot of netflix and amazon movies no issues
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: It's Still Working
customer_reviews.text: It's been about a year since I rebuilt my computer and so far it's done what it has needed to! What more can I say about it?
customer_reviews.author: David W. Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you buy the right motherboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a Generation 8 cpu, you will need a motherboard that supports this. Other than that, it is a great chip that gets everything done with minimal effort.
customer_reviews.author: Marius de Beer

customer_reviews.title: I got this i5 8400 at a great price! Shipping was fast as always
customer_reviews.text: I got this i5 8400 at a great price! Shipping was fast as always. 6 cores and 6 threads! This paired with 16 gb of ram and a m.2 this thing is fast! Great buy and great seller.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Best bang for your buck. Cheap. Stays cold as ice and plays most all newest titles at high resolution.
customer_reviews.author: wadecarlson

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money for recording studio
customer_reviews.text: Works great as a recording CPU for Steinberg Nuendo and Cubase pro
customer_reviews.author: Sunil Dixit

customer_reviews.title: Very Good CPU
customer_reviews.text: When paired with a decent GPU this CPU can run AAA titles at 100+ fps no problem, I personally like the auto boost feature where under pressure it will boost click up to 4.2 ghz
customer_reviews.author: Tech Guy

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: this thing is all a normal gamer needs maybe even a little overkill. If you can get it for the suggested retail of around 180$ it's a steal.
customer_reviews.author: ethan

customer_reviews.title: Balance between price and power
customer_reviews.text: This is the heart of my new Linux business machine and is performing very well.
customer_reviews.author: S. Clay

customer_reviews.title: Good processor
customer_reviews.text: This processor is amazing good for the price, its a must have if your on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Hung

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: It was actually the Motherboard that made it easy to install since it had a device to make sure you lined it up properly and a lever that pressed it down properly. It's been working great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Dover8888

customer_reviews.title: Well-rounded CPU for work and play
customer_reviews.text: It's not the fastest offering from Intel, but it's suitable for nearly all workloads and performs exceedingly well for the price. Can't say anything bad about it.
customer_reviews.author: Rychard

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Water cooled on a corsair dual 120mm fan rad and is performing great. No thermal throttling or problems.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Proc. Fast in combination w/ ASUS H370-F Mo ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Proc. Fast in combination w/ ASUS H370-F Mo BO and Corsair RAM.... A winning combination!
customer_reviews.author: John F. Fowlds Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Good price/performance
customer_reviews.text: Works great together a Rx580 and b360m chipset. I play csgo, starcraft 2, fifa19, SW battlefront 2, batman arkham night in high settings without any trouble. If noise is something you really care, stock cooling can be kinda noisy on high workloads.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Peredo

customer_reviews.title: Great processor
customer_reviews.text: Nice fast processor. I bought this to put in a new photobooth pc build. A little overkill for my application but since the i5 was only a little more than the i3 I couldn’t help myself. Nice and fast and runs pretty cool.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Werner

customer_reviews.title: Great cpu for gaming if you’re on a budget
customer_reviews.text: Great gaming cpu for the money. Paired it with an RTX 2080 and 16gb of ram and I am more than satisfied with my pc. I could’ve gotten an i7 or whatever else kind of cpu I wanted but wanted to give this one a try given it’s price of only $200 and it’s got 6 cores plus I was doing a b360 itx build. 👍🏼
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Good budget all around CPU
customer_reviews.text: Very good price for performance. Usually it is running 1 core at 3.9 GHz in turbo mode for simple linear processes. Stock cooler is a little loud. Get a Evo 212 or cryorig H7 and it will stay at max power with very little noise and under 50°c
customer_reviews.author: Jason V

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation, included fan is quiet and works great.
customer_reviews.text: Quick shipping, good value, easy installation, no problems with fan or anything else. Installed it on my game PC and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S.

customer_reviews.title: Good all round Processor
customer_reviews.text: It will do anything I need to do Fast Computer will Boot up in 10 seconds from restart
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: You can’t go wrong with intel
customer_reviews.text: Pops right in and you up and going reliable speeds and good performance

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck

customer_reviews.title: Great cpu

customer_reviews.author: Ian Page

customer_reviews.title: Fast and affordable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this CPU because my last one (an AMD FX-4300) wasn't cutting it anymore for my gaming needs. This one is so much faster. I couldn't be happier. Great speeds (~3.9 GHz when gaming), good price, lots of cores, and decent temperatures. I highly recommend it.

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming cpu for a decent price
customer_reviews.text: Hits 100 percent usage when using vr but other than that it's great for gaming

customer_reviews.title: Good Processor!
customer_reviews.text: Really underrated CPU. Handles most of my games at max with my 1060 6gb card.
